message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.ST, cs.DS, cs.IT. 

The paper proposes a new algorithm for multi-armed bandits with covariates, which is a problem commonly studied in the machine learning community. The paper focuses on a setting where the covariates are supported on a metric space of low intrinsic dimension, which suggests that the paper may belong to the sub-category of machine learning related to dimensionality reduction (cs.LG). The paper also discusses regret bounds and minimax optimality, which are common topics in theoretical machine learning (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper mentions a margin condition, which is a concept commonly used in statistical learning theory (cs.ST). The paper also presents empirical results, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-category of machine learning related to experimental evaluation (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the use of the KL-UCB algorithm, which is a common algorithm in information theory (cs.IT).
